title: Efficient numerical valuation of European options under the two-asset Kou jump-diffusion model. (arXiv:2207.10060v2 [math.NA] UPDATED)
abstract: This paper concerns the numerical solution of the two-dimensional time-dependent partial integro-differential equation (PIDE) that holds for the values of European-style options under the two-asset Kou jump-diffusion model. A main feature of this equation is the presence of a nonlocal double integral term. For its numerical evaluation, we extend a highly efficient algorithm derived by Toivanen (2008) in the case of the one-dimensional Kou integral. The acquired algorithm for the two-dimensional Kou integral has optimal computational cost: the number of basic arithmetic operations is directly proportional to the number of spatial grid points in the semidiscretization. For the effective discretization in time, we study seven contemporary operator splitting schemes of the implicit-explicit (IMEX) and the alternating direction implicit (ADI) kind. All these schemes allow for a convenient, explicit treatment of the integral term. We analyze their (von Neumann) stability. By ample numerical

translated_title: 两资产Kou跳扩散模型下欧式期权的高效数值估值
translated_abstract: 本文关注于解决两资产Kou跳扩散模型下欧式期权数值解的问题。其中主要困难在于非局部双重积分项的数值计算。我们基于Toivanen (2008)的算法，将其扩展至二维Kou积分模型中。得到的算法具有最优的计算成本，即基本计算操作数与空间半离散化网格点数量成正比。对于有效的时间离散化，我们研究了七种当代算子分裂方案，并分别进行了(von Neumann)稳定性分析。
tldr: 本文研究了解决两资产Kou跳扩散模型下欧式期权数值解的高效算法，成功将Toivanen的算法扩展到二维Kou积分模型中并给出最优计算成本，此外还研究了当代算子分裂方案并进行了稳定性分析。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes an efficient algorithm for solving the numerical valuation problem of European options under the two-asset Kou jump-diffusion model, which successfully extends Toivanen's algorithm to the two-dimensional Kou integral model with optimal computational cost, and studies the von Neumann stability of seven contemporary operator splitting schemes for effective time discretization.
